# allowsUndo

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the cell assumes responsibility for undo operations.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var allowsUndo: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the cell handles undo operations itself or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if the app’s custom undo manager must handle undo behavior. Cell subclasses set the value of this property to indicate their preference for handling undo operations. For example, the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFieldCell] class uses sets this property to indicate it handles undo operations for edited text, and other controls set a value that is appropriate for their implementation. Do not change the value of this property otherwise.

## Managing Cell Attributes

- **setCellAttribute(_:to:)**: Sets the value for the specified cell attribute.
- **cellAttribute(_:)**: Returns the value for the specified cell attribute.
- **type**: The type of the cell.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value indicating whether the cell is currently enabled.
